name: Tom Anderson
descriptions: Tom Anderson is the co-owner of the Westside Cooperative, living in Westside in 2281.
Anderson trained with the Followers of the Apocalypse and previously ran operations for the NCR's Office of Science and Industry.
He states that politicians back in Shady Sands are too detached from reality to advocate for the best interests of the citizens, only concerning themselves with productivity and growth.
Tom Anderson appears in Fallout: New Vegas.
Tom Anderson was written by Joshua Sawyer, who also co-wrote The White Wash with Jeff Husges.
affiliation: Followers of the ApocalypseOffice of Science and Industry(formerly)Westside Cooperative

topics.response_text: I'm not getting sucked into your fight, friend.

topics.topic_text: I heard Corporal White came here to investigate a water shortage.
topics.response_text: No one by that name has come here, I'm afraid. You must've heard wrong. You can ask around if you'd like - they'll all tell you the same thing.{Mildly threatening - he's hinting that the player should back off from this line of questioning.}
The co-op is comprised of Westside locals and run by Clayton Etienne. They produce all of their own food and share in the profits of the co-op.
I'm with the Followers of the Apocalypse, and I help the locals in Westside grow crops. Unlike the NCR, the Followers don't expect anything back.

topics.topic_text: Do you have a problem with the NCR?
topics.response_text: I don't go looking for fights with them, but they don't have the best interests of people in mind. Certainly not locals.
I suppose there's no point in denying it any longer. I killed Corporal White to protect Westside's self-reliance. It was rash, and I regret it now.

topics.topic_text: You need to answer for your crime.
topics.response_text: I'll surrender on one condition - you protect Westside's secret. Without that water, this community won't survive long.
Thank you. I won't make any trouble when they come for me.

topics.topic_text: No, I'm not going to lie for you.
topics.response_text: Then you leave me no choice.

topics.topic_text: Say I keep Westside's secret - what's in it for me?
topics.response_text: Ten percent of the co-op's profits.
Good. Tell Etienne about our deal and I'll turn myself in.

topics.topic_text: I'd rather not turn you in, but someone else might come looking for White.
topics.response_text: If the NCR thinks White was killed by, say, members from the Scorpions gang, it may be enough for them to close the case.

topics.topic_text: Consider it done. You stay free and Westside keeps getting water.
topics.response_text: Thank you. What happened was regrettable, but I'll make sure it never happens again.

topics.topic_text: Westside's secret is easily worth more, but I'm willing to settle for twenty percent.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Twenty percent it is. Etienne won't like it, but at least our secret will be safe.

topics.topic_text: I could say that... if the price was right.
topics.response_text: Perhaps a partnership in the co-op would be enough. Say, ten percent of daily profits?

topics.topic_text: If I don't turn you in, will you stop stealing NCR water?
topics.response_text: That's not a bargain I can accept. Westside depends on that water for survival and self-reliance.

topics.topic_text: It was easy to figure out that the NCR water shortage points to you - save me some time, will you?
topics.response_text: {PC Intelligence 6+}Fair enough. Since you seem to have pieced it together, I won't insult you by denying it any further.

topics.topic_text: You should know I've been helpful to the Followers, so come clean about White if you know something.
topics.response_text: Some of the other Followers mentioned you. All right - the truth, then.
